snippet: The Egyptian government’s response to violence at the American Embassy in Cairo gave the Obama administration further cause for concern.
abstract: Egyptian government’s response to violence at the American Embassy in Cairo gives the Obama administration, troubled by the direction of President Mohamed Morsi’s new Islamist government already, further cause for concern; Morsi issued only a mild rebuke of the rioters, while the Muslim Brotherhood, has called for a second day of protests against the lurid anti-Muslim video that set off the riots in Egypt and Libya.

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and MARK LANDLER

lead_paragraph: The Egyptian government’s response to violence at the American Embassy in Cairo gave the Obama administration further cause for concern.

headline.seo: Egypt, Not Libya, May Be Bigger Challenge for White House
headline.main: Spotlight Is on Libya, but Bigger Challenge for White House May Lie in Egypt
headline.print_headline: Spotlight Is on Libya, but Bigger Challenge for White House May Lie in Egypt

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
